ygData.subject: Character Creation - Attributes
ygData.msgSnippet: I m interested in people s views on the mix of STR, AGI and DEX.  I m assuming everyone thinks stamina is irrelevant. I have a high level high elf paladin that
ygData.messageBody:
I'm interested in people's views on the mix of STR, AGI and DEX. I'm assuming everyone thinks stamina is irrelevant.
I have a high level high elf paladin that can't hit the side of a barn in broad daylight from a foot away. Probable cause - poor high elven dexterity.
I started a dwarven paladin recently with STR 100, STA 95, AGI 75, DEX 105. I hit everything with ease. I'm concerned my AGI is too low - am I just going to get pummelled by everything in sight? Do people think 75 is too low, or should I set it to 80? Are there good high level paladins out there with 75 AGI or less?
I put my DEX up to ungodly levels so that I get the weapon effect (e.g. dismiss undead) more often and also hit more often - I was getting really sick of those "but miss" messages.
What do people think? Having seen a difference in combat ability below L30 and above L30, I'd be interested to hear from high level paladins about their attributes.

Thorwin, Dwarven Paladin
Llorfindal, High Elf Paladin

Dwarven Paladin 100 95 60 90 88 62 60 20
Erudite Paladin 70 75 70 70 88 105 80 20
Half Elf Paladin 80 75 90 85 65 75 85 20
High Elf Paladin 65 70 85 70 100 90 90 20
Human Paladin 85 80 75 75 80 75 85 20
